Package org.waltonrobotics.motion

Class BezierCurve

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waltonrobotics.motion.Path
      • org.waltonrobotics.motion.BezierCurve
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Line
    public class BezierCurve
extends Path

    This Path is a simple curve. The shape of the curve is controlled by the control points. There are tangents from the first and second control points and the second to last and last control points. Use this to make a straight line (use two control points)
    Wikipedia page on Bezier Curves
    Bezier curve equations for N number of control points

    Author:
    Marius Juston, Walton Robotics, Russell Newton, Walton Robotics

    • Constructor Detail

      • BezierCurve

        public BezierCurve​(double vCruise,
                   double aMax,
                   double startVelocity,
                   double endVelocity,
                   boolean isBackwards,
                   PathData startPathData,
                   java.util.List<Pose> controlPoints)
        This constructor is used with the splines, but feel free to use it when creating your own motions
        Parameters:
        vCruise - - the cruise velocity of the robot
        aMax - - the maximum acceleration of the robot
        startVelocity - - the start velocity
        endVelocity - - the end velocity
        isBackwards - - whether or not to move the robot backwards
        startPathData - - the starting PathData for the curve
        controlPoints - - the control points that define the curve

      • computeArcLength

        public double computeArcLength​(int n,
                               double lowerBound,
                               double upperBound)
        Uses the Gauss Legendre integration to approximate the arc length of the Bezier curve. This is the fastest technique (faster than sampling) when having a large path and shows the most accurate results
        Parameters:
        n - the number of integral strips 2+ more means better accuracy
        lowerBound - the lower bound to integrate (inclusive) [0,1]
        upperBound - the upper bound to integrate (inclusive) [0,1]
        Returns:
        the arc length of the Bezier curve of t range of [lowerBound, upperBound]

      • convertToString

        public java.lang.String convertToString()
        Overrides:

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Path

      • getClosestPose

        public Pose getClosestPose​(Pose inputPose)
        Finds the closest Pose in the curve to inputPose. This procedure is an optimization problem to find t where the distance between B(t) and inputPose is minimized. This works only for cubic curves.
